Because there's no reasonable way for them to determine beyond doubt that an account is a smurf.

And on top of that, there may be reasons for having a smurf that are reasonable. For example, I'm currently considering making one not to go beat up on lower ranked people, but because I used to have MMR in the range of high silver to low gold, but my ability to play this game has atrophied to the point where I'd guess I'm now mid-bronze. And yet, no matter how long I sustain a win rate well below 50%, my MMR does not budge one bit. So I'd be making a smurf so I'm able to actually play with people near my skill level.

There are pros and cons to smurfs. On one hand, smurfs usually stupidly destroy and demolish a new player. On the other hand, there are some people who smurf things other than Yi and Yasuo, and who are not total toxic ***holes. Often times they will try to help out newer players learn the game a bit more than they might just by themselves.

I think you are confusing yourself here.

A smurf is simply a lower leveled, or lower ranked account. That OR there is the key thing. A bronze still has higher level than a level 10. Often meaning they are more experienced than other level 10s. That does not mean they are good, or that only diamonds have smurfs. It just means that they have a higher leveled and ranked account that is still able to be played, and the smurf is the lower one.

Thus, a bronze player can have a smurf, and still be ending up in bronze eventually.
